required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Registry Dedicated to Assess the Risk of Ischemic and Hemorrhagic Complications of Long-term Antithrombotic Therapy in Patients With Atrial Fibrillation

lead_sponsor.agency: National Medical Research Center for Cardiology, Ministry of Health of Russian Federation

clinical_study.source: National Medical Research Center for Cardiology, Ministry of Health of Russian Federation

brief_summary.textblock: To assess the rates of ischemic and hemorrhagic complications of long-term antithrombotic therapy in patients with atrial fibrillation

detailed_description.textblock: The register is a Russian prospective single-center observational study of patients who have indications for long-term antithrombotic therapy in connection with atrial fibrillation

primary_outcome.description: stroke, myocardial infarction, stent thrombosis [definite or probable], or urgent revascularization, cqrdiac death
major, clinically relevant nonmajor, minor (BARC, ISTH,GARFIELD AF)

intervention.description: oral anticoagulants, dual or triple antithrombotic theraphy

biospec_descr.textblock: whole blood, serum, white cells, urine

study_pop.textblock: Hospitalized or outpatients with confirmed atrial fibrillation and CHA2DS2VASC > 1

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Documented atrial fibrillation with CHA2DS2VASC > 1
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who are unwilling or unable to provide informed consent. ACS within 12 months before inclusion Severe CHF (NYHA IV) Stroke within 6 months before inclusion Severe liver or muscle disease Severe kidney disease / renal failure with creatinine > 3 mg/dl Conceivable impossibility to come in touch with the patient or his family at 1-year after the intervention

overall_official.affiliation: National Medical Research Center for Cardiology, Ministry of Health of Russian Federation

facility.name: National Medical Research Center for Cardiology, Ministry of Health of Russian Federation

reference.citation: van Rein N, Heide-Jørgensen U, Lijfering WM, Dekkers OM, Sørensen HT, Cannegieter SC. Major Bleeding Rates in Atrial Fibrillation Patients on Single, Dual, or Triple Antithrombotic Therapy. Circulation. 2019 Feb 5;139(6):775-786. doi: 10.1161/CIRCULATIONAHA.118.036248.

Schjerning Olsen AM, McGettigan P, Gerds TA, Fosbøl EL, Olesen JB, Sindet-Pedersen C, Staerk L, Hansen ML, Pallisgaard JL, Køber L, Torp-Pedersen C, Gislason GH, Lamberts M. Risk of gastrointestinal bleeding associated with oral anticoagulation and non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs in patients with atrial fibrillation: a nationwide study. Eur Heart J Cardiovasc Pharmacother. 2019 Nov 19. pii: pvz069. doi: 10.1093/ehjcvp/pvz069. [Epub ahead of print]

Panchenko E, Kropacheva E, Dobrovolsky A, Titaeva E, Zemlyanskaya O, Trofimov D, Galkina I, Lifshits G, Vereina N, Sinitsin S, Vorobyeva N, Grehova L, Zateyshchikov D, Zotova I, Vavilova T, Sirotkina O, Grontkovskaya A. CYP2C9 and VKORC1 genotyping for the quality of long-standing warfarin treatment in Russian patients. Pharmacogenomics J. 2020 Feb 6. doi: 10.1038/s41397-020-0157-2. [Epub ahead of print]

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: National Medical Research Center for Cardiology, Ministry of Health of Russian Federation

patient_data.ipd_description: Individual participant data that underlie the results reported in the article after deidentification (text, tables, figures)
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Beginning 9 months and ending 36 months following publication
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Researchers who provide a methodologically sound proposal . For individual participant data meta-analysis.
